column21: plot_res is guessed area of orchid plants

plot_res is area of soil cores (note though, they were volumetric).  One of their plots (made up of 30 soil cores, which were each considered sites) was a revisiting of an secondary growth plot that had been burned and cleared in the interim.
plot_res is based on the size of a pelican chick
plot_res is an estimate of island sizes using google maps, scaled by proportion of total number of nests per lake
DOI_data_source is a link to the source of some of the mosquito data used; plot_res was assumed to be the size of the mosquito traps)
samp_duration estimate of one minute for Aqua and Terra MODIS satellites
samp_duration calculated based on yield estimates for one calendar year from M3 cropland dataset product
amount of time spent surveying gardens not indicated. Assumed mean of 1 day
assumed it took one day per garden to survey
samp_duration assumed five minutes per tree visit, average tree crown radius of 2m
plot_res is guess area of fruit, flower, seed samples, samp_duration assumed 20 minutes per sample processing time
samp_duration assumed to be one day per plot (1 plot = 3 sites)

n_sites proportionally counts pixels by the percent area land that they cover, DOI_data_source is actually ISBN of one data source, GIS products used for protected area designations were too numerous to track down, since data resolution included no temporal component, samp_duration was assumed to be the length of time during with all records were collected (e.g. 1987-2000)
plot_res was individual plants, assumed to be .25m x .25m, samp_duration assumed to be 15 minutes
samp_duration assumed to be 15 minutes, study_span ('growing season 2000') assumed to be April 15 to September 10
samp_duration assumed to be 3 hours, study_span ('growing season 2000') assumed to be April 15 to September 10, exclosure plots (1/3) were not counted
plot_res (size of average cushion) assumed to be 0.25m square, 30 minutes per cushion, 90 day study period (unlisted)
plot_res assumes transects have a 5cm width, took 5 minutes to survey, all conducted in 90 days
study_duration assumes they sampled each point each month of the study, but this was ambiguous in the text
plot_res assumed to be size of pitfall trap
plot_resolution, assumed litter depth measurements had a 1cm x 3cm cross section, took 1 minute each
NDVI data was used to illustrate methodological issues with analyzing VI data, not to actually observe patterns in nature directly
Samp_duration assumed 20 minutes per lizard, study span assumed to be one year (no information given)
samp_duration assumed to be five days for resurveys of plots
Average cross sectional area assumed to be .5m^2,
Assumed wood samples 1cm x 1cm, 1 day to process
plo_res assumed gas intake integrated over .01m2
